dcterms:creator: Leshem Choshen
Lior Fox
Yonatan Loewenstein
dcterms:description: A method using a parallel E-value MDP which has the same transition model as the original MDP, but has no rewards associated with any of the state-actions. The true value of all state-action pairs is 0, and the E-values represent the missing knowledge for propagating directed exploration.
dcterms:title: E-values MDP

dcterms:creator: Ian Osband
Benjamin Van Roy
Zheng Wen
dcterms:description: A framework for generalization and exploration in reinforcement learning via randomized value functions, specifically applied to chain MDPs.
dcterms:title: Chain MDPs

dcterms:creator: Ronen I Brafman
Moshe Tennenholtz
dcterms:description: R-max is a general polynomial time algorithm for near-optimal reinforcement learning, which maintains a complete model of the environment and acts based on the optimal policy derived from this model.
dcterms:title: R-max

dcterms:creator: Alexander L Strehl
Michael L Littman
dcterms:description: The MBIE algorithm applies model-based interval estimation for Markov decision processes, providing a theoretical analysis of exploration strategies.
dcterms:title: MBIE algorithm

dcterms:creator: Alexander L Strehl
Lihong Li
Eric Wiewiora
John Langford
Michael L Littman
dcterms:description: Delayed Q-learning is a model-free reinforcement learning method that observes one sample transition for the action taken in the current state and updates the Q-values after a fixed number of transitions.
dcterms:title: Delayed Q-learning
